text: Bottle from Redmonds. Wasnt wild on this: slightly thin in the mouth, malt got overpowered by a sweetness that didnt quite land for me. Needed more bitterness and bite.

(bottle) Clear, dark amber colour with a beige medium-sized foamy head. Toasty malty aroma with notes of caramel, shades of molasses, as if it was a diluted dark Bock, backed by delicately grassy and spicy hops. Delicately bitter and slightly sweet flavour, medium to light bodied with a modest carbonation. Toasted malt character with caramel, shades of dark cacao powder and notes of spicy and slightly grassy hops towards the moderately dry bitter-sweet finish. Solid Vienna Lager. 08.VI.17

Bouteille achetée chez Drink of The World - De couleur rouge ruby presque brune avec une belle mousse beige collante - Au nez des arômes de malt, malt caramel, malt biscuit, céréale, miel, les levure à lager donnent un côté croustillant, une pointe de torréfaction en fin de nez et des houblons terreux - En bouche les malt donnent un côté fruits rouges, très maltée, malt caramel et biscuits, malt rôti, légèrement mielleuse, houblon terreux tout pareille quau nez - Corp moyen, amertume légère/moyenne, carbonation correcte, crispy et lisse, final céréale assez court - Superbe pour le style, un style un peu oublié ces dernière année

27. 1. 2017, Ljubljana. Bottled. Copper coloured lager with a hint of roasted malt. Light bodied with slightly sweet aftertaste. Not standard lager in a good way.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smell of malt, honey. Red copper colour, small beige head. Aroma of honey, malt, sugar, a faint of oak. Sweet. Lively carbon. Slightly oily palate.

Bottle, 500ml. Clear dark orange with a frothy/creamy to minimal tan head. Spicy roasted and corn aromas. Medium bodied, fizzy carbonation. Crisp and sharp. Medium sweet, lightly bitter. Deep roasted flavors into a spicy lagerish finish.

Bottle, 500ml. A mahogany beer with a medium size head. Aroma is of some spices and wood. Taste is moderately bitter and medium sweet. Light bodied with some carbonation, smooth and with a dry aftertaste. Rich character of roasted malts. Very nice for a lager.

Tasted at Craftbeer Fest Wien 2016.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

De couleur caramel, elle arbore une tête de mousse classique qui séteint rapidement. Les odeurs sont de beurre, de caramel, de malt dherbes et de moulée. Le goût est sucré; caramélisé et cest plutôt aqueux. Bien ordinaire en ce qui me concerne. (1861-300616)
Bottle. Pours chestnut brown. Strong malty aroma with bread and raisin. Sweetish malty taste with some nuttiness.

500ml bottle. Clear dark amber brown colour with a small beige head lasting only a minute or so. Aroma of dark malt, lots of dark fruits. Tastes like a strong lager, really nice malty flavour, caramel, fruits, some hops too, bit of spice. Nice bitter finish. Medium body. Not a style Id usually go for but I quite liked this.
[5/16/16] Draught at Taphouse in Copenhagen. Clear amber. Aroma of malt, toast, vegetal note, noble hops note. Sweetish flavor with malt, toast, and a bitterish noble hops finish.
Very full round nutty taste with caramel aroma, not grainy tasting at all. On tap at the Hanging Bat Edinburgh.

Keg at The Hanging Bat. Amber clear. Nose is dank, sweet malts. Tastes sweet malts, dank, red fruits. Not my style.
Keg at the Hanging Bat. Pours clear amber with a thick white head. Aromas of sweet, creamy malt. Taste is sweet, faint herbal note. Sweet finish. Not my bag.
Bottle, 500 ml, from Pivoljub. Shared with Miro B. Pours dark amber, small off white head. Caramel malty, sweetish, hint of fruit. Medium bodied. Bit disappointed.

Something about this beer. I love a Vienna lager and this hits all the right notes. Its got a sweet malt aroma, caramel, some citrus, then the taste follows suit. Its hoppy and crisp, some biscuity and pine notes, finishing really clean, and it just drags you in. Delicious, refreshing, easy-drinking.
Keg @ Drink? Hebden Bridge. Clear mid-brown with a creamy off-white head. Has a crisp darker sweetness running through the ale with toffee notes which are at their most stated in its taste.

5%ABV. Vienna Lager.

Tapped out a dark brown amber red. 25ºSRM.

Nose is full of mead and sweet raw honey, red dates.

Aggressively carbonated to offset the solid dark malt flavor which is present in abundance. nutty. graham cracker, browned wheat toast, barley bread. 

Finish is short hops. Light fruit. Ok for me...
500ml bottle at home. Okay but not particularly memorable, Im sorry. Dont get me wrong I love Thornbridge.

Sweet, honeylike aroma with sweet malts, ahorn. Nice golden / copper colour, almost white foamy head. Round pretty full sweetish flavour. Full malty with hints of pine, maple and nuts. A bit dry and tinckling on the palate.
Heldere koper bruine kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt niet zoveel. Smaakt zoetig, mout.
Amber helder bier met een goede getinte schuim kraag. Ruikt caramel, mout. Smaakt mout, caramel. Saai.

Bottled 500ml. -from Pivoljub Ljubljana. Clear amber coloured, small off-white head, light caamel in the nose. Moderate malty, fruity, caramel, dust and notes of sugar with malty caramel finish. So far the worse of eight Thornbridge beers Ive tried. Pitty.

50cl flesje bij John Mullins, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 5%
Uitgeschonken in origineel Thornbridge glas

Uiterlijk: roosbruin met kleine schuimkraag 

Aroma en smaak: moutig, bittertje, licht fruitig 

Conclusie: amarillo hop niet echt te proeven, het is niet heel verkeerd maar niet uitdagend 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample (keg) at The Craft Beer Co, Clerkenwell, on 13-Aug-2015 - Thornbridge tap takeover as part of London Beer City 2015. Clear reddish amber colour with a small off white head. Medium body and carbonation. Aroma is slightly floral, malt and grain. Slightly sweet caramel malt flavour, biscuit and floral pine. Drinkable, but far from the best Thornbridge beer that i have bad this evening.

At Craft Clerkenwell, London. Clear dark Amber beer with a rich beige head. Malty caramel aroma, fruity, breads, spicy notes. Malty caramel flavor, grainy, dark bread, some spicy floral notes. Unclean beer.

On tap @ Patricks. Clear dark amber body with a lacing tan head. Aroma is mainly malty with hint of dry fruit. Flavor is quite sweet malt, some caramel, dry fruit and moderate bitterness. Fine body and pleasant aftertaste. A bit sweet, but decent within ins style.

Deep amber to red colored, small off white head. Aroma is of caramel, candy, some herbal hops. Taste is medium+ sweet caramel, candy-fruity, orange, some biscuit and a bready finish. Low+ herbal bitter finish. Medium bodied and carbonation. Is nice!

Bottled, 500ml from Tebay Services, Orton, Cumbria. Reddish brown with cream head. There is a sweet note on pouring which transfers as a caramel flavour on drinking. Thickish malts with a medium carbonation, slightly burpy beer then a light hopping, herbal, leafy notes, adding to the marking. Reasonable enough.
Patricks 170715. Amber colour with a beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, grain, floral. Flavour is malt, caramel, grain, floral, bread, hop. Medium body. OK beer.

Draught @ Haand Ølfestival 2015, Drammen
Pours clear brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, grain and floral. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long caramel, biscuit, grain and floral finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Pours dark red-amber, aroma is gentle and yeasty. A lot of head, that slowly diminishes. Taste is very full, excellent body, sweet at first, a hint of barley, then it finishes with a slight hoppy, carbonated taste. A very good beer.

sample from bottle at 24 uurs maastricht. poured a slight murky amber colour with a tanned head. nose of dark caramel malts, raisins, caramel sweetness, cookies, slight herbal notes, spiced yeast, toffe, with a slight bitterness in the aftertaste.

Keg at The Port Street Ale House, Manchester. A slightly hazy brown colour with a thin white head. Aroma of caramel, cola, a little blackberry, fruity malt and floral hops. Taste of caramel, blackberry, fruity malt, berries, some grain and floral hops. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A dry but fruity finish. Easy drinking and has some nice flavours, decent but not unique
Bottle from Brown and Greens, Trentham. Pours red brown with off white froth. Caramel, spice, nicely carbonated. Enjoyed it.
On Tap. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 15/05/2015. Aroma malta, caramelo, sabor dulce, cuerpo medio, carbonatacion suave.
Bottle a amber colored beer with a white head aroma malts caramel dark fruits and some hops flavor malts caramel dark fruits citrus some yeast and bitter hops

Bottle from Cellar Door.

Pours medium brown with single finger white head. Aroma of malts, grain, grass. Taste of malts, sweet malt, toffee, caramel, grain, grass. Touch of orange. Nice.
Bottle from Corks Out Heswall, Ruby colour with white head. Aroma is malty, and sweet caramel. Taste is the same.

Lukt: Plomme, rosin og krydder.
Utseende: Rødbrun farge.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Fruktig, Plomme, rosin og krydder.

amber brown with a slight red hue and white head, smells like bready caramel malts mixed with citrus hops, taste is bitter citrus hops mixed with bready malts, slight caramel & dark fruits, both parts of this beer hops & malts are clearly present, medium body and carbonation

Bottle 0.5l at Samo Pivo Belgrade Serbia.Taste with Dzaca,Djeda and Kum Vlada.04.04.2015.Pour it clear dark amber color with small white head.On the nose winegar, caramel back.Taste and aroma of caramel malt, some fruit notes,biscuit, bitter finish.Quite light and not so well complexed I think.Dzaca said this is the best beer for her that night.

Pours a clear, deep amber color, topped with a decent off-white head. Malty aroma, caramel present, but very grassy. Taste is slightly sweet with nice notes of caramel. A bit of bitterness, but otherwise very mild taste. Not bad, except for the aroma.
Very nice Amber style lager with a very sweet, malty and somewhat hoppy aroma.
Bottle at home. Pours deep amber, nose is yeasty, malty toffee, taste is similar, a little grassy.
Bottle from celler door, four oaks, Sutton coldfield. Ruby brown beer with large foam head. Aroma of malts and caramel. Taste is malts, caramel, sweet and a little hop. Nicely balanced. Good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: from Bier-Bienne - hazy copper-brown beer with a persistent beige foam; nice lace; earthy and flowery aroma; creamy palate; medium-bodied and decently bitter; long dry earthy and biscuity finish - a good beer from a style too rarely brewed
Surprising sweetish taste and smell. Nice malty bitterness but a bit more watery than typical top fermented beers. Though one of the best bottom fermented beers I had so far.

Dark amber color with big beige head. Very sweet, fruity, much caramel. Taste is sweet, caramel malts, fruity, berries. Moderate bitter finish. Nice berry-like aftertaste, a hint of bitter chocolate. A solid Vienna lager. Smooth english carbonation, nice mouthfeel.
Bottle. Rich caramel malts, lightly sweet, nice balance and body. PRetty nicely done Vienna lager.

500ml bottle from AleselA, Glasgow - clear deep amber brown, lot of fine rising bubbles, large creamy beige head, sweet caramel, fruity aroma, good intermittent lacing, high carbonation, malty but well balanced by a good bitter hop finish

Bottle from Hofstättner brewery shop. Deep clear mahogany colour, big bubbly head. Sweet hazelnut cookie nose. Fine high carbonation, mouthwatering. Tastes of burnt/roast gingerbread with a hefty hearty steely hop finish. Excellent!

50cl bottle at home. Pale amber brown with a medium white soapy head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Bitterness combined with some sweet tones. Malts, caramel, brown sugar, hay, raisins and herbs. Although the vienna is not really my type of beer, this one is quite ok.

Bottle. Pours clear deep amber fleeting off white head, nice lacing. Inviting aroma. Pleasant malts consistent with the style. Hops are good but I was hoping to taste a little more amarillo. Id certainly drink it again but not at the price I payed tonight.

50cl. Bottle. 
Pours clear dark amber with tan head. 
Aroma caramel, toffee, bread, some hay and citrus, sweet. 
Taste caramel sweets, fresh little bitter. 
Mouthfeel thin. 
Nice beer.

Bottled. 25cl sample. The aroma has caramel/toffee malts and grassy hops. Clear, amber-copper coloured beer with an off-white, thin-medium head. The taste is light-moderate bitter, has caramel malts and grassy hop tones. Thats it. Dull and boring.

Draught @ Moeder Lambic, Fontaines. Pours amber with a white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, light bread, grass, light citrus. Flavor is malt, caramel, grassy hops, light citrus. Medium body, average carbonation. 300714

500ml bottle at home, poured into a glass tankard, ABV 5%.
Light amber coloured beer, little activity in the clear body,with a small and thin tan head sitting on top. Low retention, it leaves light lacing on the glass.
Aroma of caramel, toffee, light roasted malts, milky chocolate. 
Taste also of caramel, roasted malts on the finish, fresh grass, a bit sweet at first but quite intense bitterness on the aftertaste, lasting long too.

Clear reddish beer with a decent foamy head. Light hop and fruit aroma. Flavour is hoppy and with an apple flavour. Its got good body to it and an almost malty finish. Very nice.

Bottle from On the Alley, Manchester. Pours a deep amber with a foamy off white head. Aroma is malty, and caramel, with a taste very similar with some bitter aftertaste. Overall, pretty okay Vienna style lager but pretty by the books.
Bottle. Brown clear body with tan head. Aroma is malts with bread. Taste is some caramel malts with biscuits. Aftertaste is medium bitter with some malts. I think the bottle wad to old.

Drunk from 50cl bottle bought at Malting Pot, Brussels. Refreshing Vienna style lager with hoppy taste.

500 ml Bottle 

Appearance: Dark ruby with a beige head. 
Aroma: Caramel, red apples, toasted bread,grains an a hint of red fruit. slight date/raisin, some bitterness, fruity, toasted bread.slightly bitter finish
Tsste: grains,caramel, mals, medium sweet up front in the finish some light bitterness with some nice hops.
 Medium body, medium carbonation, 


Good brew in its style and a nice twist are the hops in he finish but for that reason it has to be quite fresh.

Bottle bought from Blue Glass, Bedford. Consumed in the comfort of my own dwelling. Germany are beating Brazil 7-0. Back to the beer: the colour is light reddish-brown. Scent of caramel malt and rosehips. Taste is surprisingly fruity and sweet at the front, with a slight bitter edge in the finish and aftertaste. Thin palette, but the carbonation is pleasant on the lips. Not many amber lagers are better than this, a good take on a fairly ordinary style.
An okay beer from Thornbridge, they are specialized in ipas and english ales, this one is not so good but however okay, lot of grains taste, wheat, citrus.

Lager rossa con abondante schiuma bianca. Al naso note fruttate e caramellose. In bocca corpo medio e bilanciatura giusta. Sapore maltato con amaro poco persistente. Finale aromatico lungo. Bevuta in botiglia a LLeida nel On The Rocks....peccato che la birra era un po vecchia.

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Dark amber, creamy beige head. Smell of caramel, dark fruits, dark malts, dried fruits, hints of citrus. Moderate sweet, some caramel, some dark fruits; goes quite fast over to a medium bitter finish of resins and green leafs. Quite straight forward, not much going on here. Not my favourite from this brewery

Bottle from Rehills Newcastle. Pours dark tan colour, thin head. Lovely strong malty flavours, very rich and deep in flavour - I normally tend to enjoy Thornbridge's Pale Ales more than their other styles but this is a really nice departure

Pours a clear orange/brown with a dense tan head. The smell is rich, toasted malt, caramel, earth. The taste is rich and roast, some fruit, some caramel sweetness and a dry crisp counterbalance at the end. Light + in body with nice tight carbonation.

Bottle at le mondiale 2014. 
Uber malty aroma, smell like fresh mash in the kettle, loads of fresh cereals and grains, its just lovely, the hops appear in the end in the form of light grassy notes. I could drink this everyday, just a great daily drinking beer,

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein kupferfarbenes Bier mit schöner beiger Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, Karamell, leicht schokoladig. Geschmack röstmalzig, schokoladig, Karamell, leicht fruchtig, minimal hopfig.

Bottle 50 cl from the Internets. Ruby/slightly brown with a beige head. Caramel, red apples, slight date/raisin, some bitterness, fruity, toasted bread. Medium body, medium carbonation, slightly bitter finish. Quite balanced. A good example of caramel use.

Mild aroma of caramell, red apples and some berry and dark fruit notes. Ruby clear colour, white head. Taste is roasted bready sweetness, with citrus elegantly balanced with bitterness, although the malt is the main player. Medium body average carbonation. Nice lager, although could have been a bit lighter in body and have mor hop aroma, but maybe too old bottle.

BOTTLE 50CL,

Look: clear ruby, big beige frothy head.
Aroma: starts with a heavy grainy aroma that evaporates fast. Then malty, bready, some burnt sugar, herbal hops, hay.
Taste: some caramel sweetness, balanced by hop peppery bitterness with a peppery zesty character.
Red brown colour. Light toasty malt in the aroma and that comes through in the taste too. Nice balance of maltiness with subtle bitterness of the hop.

50 cl bottle
Blond, white head. Light nose with grains and hpps. Mouthfeel not good as others of their stuff. Taste of grains, wheat, hops. Ok!
Bottle the greystones Sheffield. Dark red amber colour slight beige head aroma is pale malts. Taste is pale malts some fruity notes light bitterness. Medium body. ok amber larger.
Bottle from greystones, Sheffield. Red colour with a respectable off white head. Lagery fruity aroma. Similar taste, but with an additional bite of bitterness. Typical lager palate.
Bottle at warrys. Dark reddish brown, lasting beige head. Nice maltiness, soy sauce, hint of chocolate. Overall an enjoyable vienna. Dont know the style well but tasty and drinkable.
bottle, pours amber with white head. Malty and caramel aroma. In taste also malt and caramel, light bitterness, medium body. Light bitter finish
Bu à la pression en 33cl, couleur ambrée et mousse épaisse, une grosse odeur de blé avec una attaque violente sur le malt.

A dark coppery beer with a quite big and blond head. The nose is bready, some caramell, wood and lemon. Taste is quite similar than aroma. Toffeeish and bready malts, some citrusfruits, nice bitterness. Medium bodied, nice and fresh carbonation, could be more smooth. A basic beer from Thornbridge at this time, no mistakes but also quite boring.

Bière légère en bouche, à la robe dun beau rouge foncé. Malts bien présents mais manque de corpulence.
Bue et à boire bien fraîche, si possible à la pression

500ml bottle @Cimmeria.25-2-2014.
In short: a correct amber lager.
Pours deep amber, quite clear, with nice off white head. Short head retention, some lacing. Malty, caramel, fruity and roasty aromas. Light to medium body, average carbonation, oily texture. Taste is caramel, some fruity hints, nice subtle roasty flavours. Well balanced, smooth and quite enjoyable. Well executed one.

Tap @ Põrgu. Pours red amber with off white head. Aroma is caramel, malt, sweetness, caramel. Taste: malty, sweet, caramel, watery, hoppy bitterness. Overall: not bad for the style, but too much carbo for me. It seems to be common problem with every Thornbridge beer that I have tasted.

On tap at CBC Brixton. Pours a slightly murky reddy brown colour with a white head. Light aroma, not a huge amount that's discernible to be honest. Light to medium body, full carbonation, a little thin. Caramel, light woodiness, and that's about it. Very little to this. Not great.

(Keg at William K Kurvi, 20140207) The beer poured mahogany coloured and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had malts, caramel and metallicness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, caramel, grass, sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste was grassy and bitter. Not bad but a bit harsh beer.

0.5l bottle. This is a as clear deep amber brown looking one with a medium sized nicely lacing off-white top. On the nose it gives me a little bit of watery caramel and floral sweetness. Light grainy and some faint hints of coffee in the back. Well, not to exciting really but fair enough. Tastes alright I suppose. Quite sweet and mealy. Thin oily in the mouth and it has a average kinda big bubbled carbonation level. Its kinda drying my mouth in a dusty way. Malty biscuits and its leaving a gentle earthy bitterness in the finish and aftertaste. No huge fan of this genre, but I suppose this is not the worst Vienna Ive had. 25.11.2013
Draught at WilliamK. Red / copper color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, caramel, hops, fruits and nuts. Bitter finish with citrus, caramel and malts. Very nice vienna.

Cask at The Gun. It pours light brown with a small beige head. Aroma is malty with caramel, toffee and grass. Taste is malty, a tad sweet but finishes fruity and grassy. Medium mouthfeel with good carbonation. Hoppy for the style but good.

Clear dark amber, medium beige head. Bready malt, fruity-floral hops in the aroma. Taste is grassy-citrci hops, toasty malt, caramel hints. Somewhat hoppy finish. Medium body, oily mouthfeel, smooth carbonation. Very drinkable.
Bottle. Dark amber color. Soft bready floral notes in the aroma. Malty bready caramelly soft floral hopbitter flavor with hints of chocolate. Tasty. Fairly well balanced. Satisfying beer.

Appearance: Clear nutty color with a fine tan head. Ok lacing.Aroma: Fruity, mild hoppy and caramel malty.Palate: Medium body. Moderate sweet and an ok bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Malty, mild fruity and a mild fresh hoppy tail.Overall impression: Often a dull style. This one was quite nice.Personal stats: Bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika in Oslo, Norway
Nicely malted lager that is pleasant to drink. Pored much darker than I was expecting.
Keg @ The Vintage, Edinburgh. Pours Brown with a reddish hue. Quite sweet on the nose and on the palate with caramel and the malts, the hoppy bitterness comes through in the aftertaste.
Draught. Deep amber with a thin head. Aroma is slight raspberry. Flavor is watery malt, some pepper, dry tangy finish. Gets better as you drink it.
Appearance: red body, tiny white head. Aroma: tea, some spice, a little hoppy with some cereal. Flavour: caramel, lightly hopped with a refreshing sweetness and a long sticky finish. Not bad.

500ml bottle. Surprisingly dark copper colour with pretty much no head. Zesty aroma. Flavours if malt and a little citrus. A little caramel there too. Uncomplicated. Decent if somewhat middle of the road.

Pours a clear bronze amber with a decent sized, but somewhat short lived head. Aroma with caramel, malts and notes of bread and biscuit. Taste is well balanced, light bitterness and a solid malty taste. Dry finish. Medium body and medium to high levels of carbonation.
Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is floral hops, some bready caramel malt. Flavour is light caramel, liquorice, malt. Light to medium floral hop bitterness to back things up.
On tap at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours clear amber with a small head. Aroma of caramel, light spicy and herbal. Taste is light/moderate sweet herbal caramel, light dry finish.

Pours dark amber with decent head, looks great. Aroma has bready yeast, grassy and some fruity hops. Taste has some caramel, bread, some hops, not entirely pleasant but ok. Quite sweet with not much dryness.
Smaksprøve mens vi venter på dsjt: minner veldig om Berentsen Rav både i utseende og smak. Godt drikkbar, men amber er en litt intetsigende stilart.

Bottle @ Deans pale lager tasting, courtesy of jmgreenuk. Pours a clear amber beer with a thin, off white head on top. Aroma is very fruity, caramel, malty and cherries. Flavor has a light bitter touch to it with a short, sweet finish. Quite a fruity example of the style.

Bottle at Deans Pale Lager tasting, Den Haag. Poured a clear dark amber with a thin off white head. The aroma is malt, bitter hops. The flavour is medium bitter. Medium bodied with a metallic palate and a short bitter finish.

Bottle shared thanks to Jmgreenuk. Pours clear amber brown with a ring tan head. Aroma of light malts and caramel. Flavour is light moderate sweet and bitter. Light to medium bodied with light carbonation.
Bottle thanks to jmgreenuk. Pours clear copper. Light Aroma, some malts and citrus. Taste is medium bitter. Medium body with soft carbonation.

50cl bottle shared @ THT November 2013.
Almost no head or carbonation. Clear amber pour. A nice vienna

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 05.11.2013, 0,5l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is caramel malts, nuts, grass, rye bread, hay, and some sulfur-ish notes as well. Taste is slightly dry, roasted nuts, hay, grass, caramel malts, grain. Longlasting mild slightly harsh bitterness. Fair enough for a completely boring style.

Keg at CBC clerkenwell, Thanks to Paul for pour. Clear amber / caramel colour with no head. Aroma is wet grass / , munich alt, some alt characteristics. Flavour is nuytty / light caramel, light grassy hop. Average carbonation/ medium sweet.
Tap. Clear dark copper color. Tiny head. Very weak aroma. Raisins, sweet and some caramel are detectable. Caramel, hops and burnt sugar in taste. Very watery and bland.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2013 Meaningless average score on this one from vastly different bottle and tap samples.
500ml bottle (Gambrinus, Tartu) (7:4:6:4:13=3.4)
Lovely rich read, small frothy head, which fades slowly. Lovely aromatic lager in the glass, lots of citrussy hop, plenty of sweet fruity esters. Simple palate, a little watery, but some gentle carbonation, and the bite of nbonble hops crispens it up a bit. Lots of bready grains in the taste. Tons of esters and some ginger in the retronasals. Quite simple, but the hops build with each sip. Plenty of dirty autumnal leafy bittering hops, leaves the mouth with a little tingle and very dry. Very nice.
Rerate: Tap (Pudel, Tallinn) (5:3:5:2:10=2.5)
What the fuck? Where are the hops? Just caramel on the nose. Watery palate, a bit fizzy, like a typical macro fizz lager. Taste also just dark caramel malts. Sweet, but no fullnes. Poor dark lager. Very disappointed.

Keg at Craft ClerkyMcWell. It pours deep amber with a minimal white head. The nose is earthy, toasty, twig, dirt and nuts. The taste is earth, toast, good malty backbone, brownbread, slightly watery, metallic, mild bitterness, light spice and nut with a dry finish. Medium body and fine, prickly carbonation. Smooth and easy drinking, but not particularly exciting.

500 ml bottle, from Voldby Købmandsgaard. BB date 27.06.12. ABV is 5%. A fresh batch will soon be available on tap at Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger - will rerate then. Reddish amber colour, large off-white head. Moderate aroma, but nice enough (no stale notes) - fruity hops come forward. The flavour appears remarkably fresh and fruity, decent Amarillo and Tettnanger hops throughout. Mild caramel in the background, but not too sweet. Yes, I can imagine that "this is a beer best drunk as fresh as possible - but it holds its own very well even more than a year past BB date.

On tap @ Henrik, Bergen. Clear bronze-hued body, small off-white head. Nose is nuts, caramel, grain husks and hints of rye bread. Taste is astringent nutty tones, chlorine, grains, hints of straw. Medium crisp body, medium carbonation. Fair enough, but no more.

Tap at Sheffield Tap. Clear, dark amber. Thick, consistent, off white head. Plenty of carbonation, but not to the beers detriment. Aroma is dark malt with a damson like sweetness. Plenty of tang too, possibly from the late hopping? Taste is sweet, no doubt, but the tang is also evident. Interesting stuff, not entirely my cup of tea though.

2011 vintage 660 ml bottle at home. Pours deep orangy amber with a bubbly yellow-ish beige head. Nutty aroma, honey, plums. Medium body, small oaky notes together with lingeirng sweetness. Taste is wood, slight orange peel, raisins.
Cerveza ambarina con espuma blanca. Un sabor y olor muy acaramelado, ligeramente tostado y fondo dulce.

(50 cl bottle) Dark copper, clear, yellowish beige head. Reminds me of redcurrant on the nose. Aroma is very nutty-malty, with a wonderful herbal spiciness, and a little resiny . Taste is medium bitter with just a little sweetness. Medium body, very ling aftertaste with lingering hops. 
I love that this beer combines a very malty base with a crisp and fresh character and layers of hops. Tasty!

bottle at lautre oeil, aylmer. pours clear medium dark copper with a minimal off-white head, some retention. caramel and toastiness, earthy, crisp lager-like toasted malts, some spices, light herbal-grassiness. prickly carbonation, light body - tad watery, short herbal-grassy and dry finish. quenching. kind of plain but still.. i enjoyed it.

Thornbridges Kill Your Darlings is my last beer of the night. ５％Vienna lager. Bottle from Rakuten, nice amber brown color, which seems to a characteristic of Vienna Lagers. Malty, sweet aroma, nice malt caramel flavor with a mild bitter finish. I am not a lager guy, but Vienna type lagers seem pretty good. My wife is happy to be enjoying a beer with dinner(^_-)

Bottle from Yamaichi. Hoppy and a bit minty, good caramel, and bready. Reddish/dark amber. Caramel up front / some serious hopping and roast grain in mid / finishes balanced and pleasant. Thin-medium body. Pretty good. Hoppier than the average Vienna.
Bottle. Caramelly and nutty malts nicely blended with citric hoppy notes. Medium body, hints of tea in the citric flavour. Rather strong bitterness. Good one!

Bottle - 500ml. Nice copper body with a thin off-white foamy head. Decent malty/hoppy aroma with herbal and brown sugar hints. Taste is well balanced and carries caramel as well as some woody notes. Ends with a fair bittersweet finish. Decent Vienna.

beige head that disappears with very little lacing. amber coloured clear beer. aroma of malt, caramel and yeast. starts off slight caramelsweet followed by bitterness with a short bitter aftertaste. medium carbonation and reasonable mouthfeel despite the low abv. ok thirstquencher.  bottle 50 cl @ baden baden / best before 4-1-2014

Dark, murky, mahogany/copper, frothy head that settles to nothing. Toffee and caramel, leather, roast malt, hints of liquorice and sweaty yeast on the nose. Interesting! Soft malt profile dominates the flavour - toast, liquorice, hints of boiled vegetables, and a touch of vinegar(!). Getting weird now. All these flavours mellow out as it warms up. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, a slightly grainy mouhtfeel. Comes together in the finish as dunkel-like. Strange, but not terrible. Think I was expecting something like a Brooklyn or Sam Adams, which this aint.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines. Red hued, with a glorious beige head. Sometimes, its hard to describe just how satisfying a beer from the Lager family can be. Bish doesnt believe me - he thinks Im a mendicant, or perhaps some kind of Uriah Heep character. Its true that I do, fairly often, enjoy the perverse collecting pleasure of lower class Lagers, but beyond the undoubted ironic appreciation, I do genuinely love Lagers. I love the stress free appreciation, I love the simple gratification. Meanwhile, outside of boring la-la-land, this is a brusque satisfying beer. Dry, peppery, with demerera sugar, with some nut and choc bar. Like it.

On tap at Crowbar, Oslo. Deep amber with an off-white head. Aroma of dark fruits, caramel and malt with some roasty notes and hints of wood. Medium sweet, mild and malty with a light bitterness in the finish. Quite well balanced and enjoyable. (2013-04-14)

This may be called a lager but it is a great beer! It is a strong beer and has a deep brown colour fading to red with time, It has a mild coffee coloured head and a strong aroma of roasted malts. There are subtle tastes of caramel and citrus fruits but not overpowering and creates a smooth beer. There is nothing particularly special about this beer but it is a pleasant drink.
Reddish brown. Sweet malt, some fruit. This style is not the most exciting, but Thornbridge has addes some hops to give a subtle bitterness that is spot on. Refreshing.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown colour with a hint of red, malt aroma, the taste is bitter with malt with a dry finish.

On tap at Schouskjelleren, february 8th 2013. Dark orange body, foamy white head. Aroma of malt, citrus hops, caramel. Taste is dry lager yeast, lightly roasted and grapefruit. Thinbodied, low carbonation, sweet swallow and a dry malty aftertaste. A bit hard to place.
Pours a dark amber. This style is not my most favourite so I may be a bit biased. Aroma is very minimal and taste very subtle, malty and carmel, but other than that nothing to write home about.
My first rating - a tasty beer, fairly bitter with a bit of fizz. Went nicely with a Craft Beer Co. scotch egg.

Bottle from Beer Hawk. Poured a wonderful bright amber brown. Sweet malty caramel toffee hit, then crisp finish from the hops. A very well-made, lager, I doubt this style can get much better than this.

500ml bottle. Pours out a darkish copper with plenty of cream head. The aroma is really rather subtly and unexpectedly good. Theres layers of caramel underneath and you can really smell the amarillo on top. The taste is lightly smoked malt, maple, caramel, honey, a hint of apple and more of those hops. Tasty! Slight bitterness with a fairly clean, dry finish. I ought to drink more beers of this style.

50cl bottle from Bitter Virtue, Southampton. Copper in colour with a rapidly vanishing cream head; aroma of orange and caramel; soft, smooth and caramelly in the mouth; with some dry orangey fruitiness giving a crisp finish. Really easy drinking.
Fra fat på Craft Beer Co, Brixton 4 Nov 12. Mørkebrun / amber. Brukbart off-white skum. Plommearoma. Smaken også plommer. Bra - men litt vassen. Søt maltaktig ettersmak.

Vienna, eh? Possibly my most unexplored style. Bottle. Dark copper with a thinning off white foam. Aroma of fig and battered sausage. Fig, caramel, lightly balsamic-sprinkled chipshop batter flavour. Hints of liquorice. Very doppelbocky in feel. A reminder that beer doesnt need to be humming with hops to be interesting or flavoursome.

Draft @ Euston Tap, Euston NW1 Pours a slightly hazy dark ruby amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty weak caramel aroma. Fruity malty caramel flavor. has a fruity malty caramel grainy finish.
Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. Dark ruby red / brown in colour with red fruity and spicy orange flavours and a zesty, fruity finish.

(Draught at Delirium Hoppy Loft, Brussels, 18 Oct 2012) Dark reddish amber colour with creamy, beige head. Fruity, malty nose with red fruit, caramel, toast, orange peel and roasted grain. Malty, fruity taste with notes of caramel, red fruit, toasty grain and some citric hops in a finish with fairly low bitterness. Medium body, with a certain sweetness. Quite nice.

Half-pint from keg at Craft Beer Co Brixton, shared with Finn. Firm off-white head over a deep, dark amber coloured body. Nutty malts to the nose, semi-sweet. Earthy malts, nuts and almond in the flavour profile as well as a tad of dried fruits. Bittersweet malty ending. Medium bodied. Pleasant (London, 04.11.2012).

Tasted from the bottle, on 28/11/2012.
Pours of dark copper color with a huge foam.
Aroma is quite intense, mostly caramely sweet, slightly grapefruity in the end and a bit boozy.
Mouthfeel is smooth, low-to-mild carbonated.
Taste is interesting, a bit tart upfront, then changing into the sour/malty sweet mix.
Aftertaste is quite tart, then a bit astringent and just slightly hoppy bitter in the end. (though the bottle was off the best before).
Neutral.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

pours very dark ( darker than amber beers even) with a scent of sweetness. so far, vienna beets al the other lager-styles .
nice carbo, little bit dryness, very (dark?) malty taste, sugary as well, drinkability of a lager, sweet malty aftertaste

Bottle. Dark amber with a offwhite head which faded in the glass. Toffee aroma with a hint of tropical fruit. Lots of carbonation, which leads to fruitiness and then bags of nicde sweet maltiness. Light and easy to drink with a light-bitter finish. A quality lager.

Aroma: Sweet malt and caramel.

Appearance:  Deep amber body with a thick off-white head. Very light carbonation. Good lacing. 

Taste: Malty and sweet - not my favourite qualities in a beer (I prefer hoppy, fruity and bitter), but this is very tasty and well balanced. 

Palate: Medium body with an oily mouthfeel. Lively carbonation. 

Overall: Tastes like a cross between an amber ale and a lager. Very sweet and the malts dominate in this one.
Dark copper colour. Toffee caramel aroma. Taste is a bit fruity, malty and caramel

Bottle. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Heavy malty and hoppy aroma. Some caramellic notes. MOderate bitter nice flavor. Some caramellic notes. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate. NIce hoppy vienna.

On bottle from shop in Wirksworth.
Deep brown color, ok foam.
Aromas of malt, moderate dried fruit and caramel- nice subtle hoppy aromas as well.
Medium body & complexity.
Medium/low carbonation- well balanced
Very enjoyable session beer
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; pours dark brown almost black, tastes like liquidised christmas cake nuts, molasses, dried fruits. Great mouth feel very silky.

On draft at the firefly. Ruby red colour, short lived white head, lively carbonation. Aroma of caramel, subtle toffee, sweet malty tones. Taste has plenty of malty flavour with a hint of hops. Getting the Amarillo just about. Well balanced. Never had a Vienna lager before so its hard to compare.

500ml bottle - a nice looking chestnut brown body, thick white head that fades a bit. A lot of toffee and sweet caramel in the nose, a bit malty too. Medium body as described, Taste a sweet malt, a few fruits in there, altogether it is pretty crisp and decent beer.

Tap at the Euston Tap - 21/09/12.
Clear chestnut brown with a thin white head that retains well.
Malts, sugars, dark fruit tones and a light dose of toffee on the nose.
Taste follows, a bit more toffee, biscuit malt, cake mix, bread.
Medium bodied with a fair dose of spritzy carbonation. 
Drinkable but a little on the bland side.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from La Cave à Bulles. Pours dark copper with a slight beige head. Quite a bit of floral and light fruit in the aroma. Med body. Flavor is light floral and light fruit over some lightly roasted malt. Finishes not quite dry, and the hop is subtle, rather than harsh, but all in all its a tasty drink. Lot of flavor in this one.
Keg. Dark amber.orange, lasting light tan head. Nose is sweet malts and some grassy hops. Taste is sugar, caramel, toast, piney hops. Strong, solid body for a lager.

Frischer, dunkel getreidiger Start mit angenehmen Karamell- und deutlichen stärkeren Hopfennoten. Geringe, sich langsam steigernde Bitterkeit. Würzig bleibend, das Bier steigert sich dabei zum Mittelteil vor allem in der Hopfenintensität und der dahinter stehenden Grasigkeit. Wenig holzig. Rund, würzig, erfrischend, gut! 9/11/11/12/9/11

Bouteille de 500 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Légère odeur de caramel fruité. Apparence: La couleur est dorée foncée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel avec une pointe de noix et dhoublons. Durée moyenne de larrière goût.  Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de céréales en arrière goût. (Rating #4285)
Color: nice clear dark amber beer with medium brown white head. Smell: wheat, roasted, caramel. Taste: wheat and caramel. Aftertaste: caramel.

A lightly hazed copper amber vienna with a thick big bubbled brown head. In aroma, nice sweet nutty caramel malt wiht light British hops. In mouth, a smooth sweet nuttycaramel with light mocha coffee, faint grassy hops, good for the style. Bottle from Bieropholie.
Cerveza tostada con muy buen sabor y de apenas amargor. Está bastante bien.
On tap. Darkish amber, foamy head. Aroma is malty, nutty, spicy. Taste is floral hops and sweetness. A great example of a great style.

A nice decorative white sheet sits above the fizzy auburn. Profound malt nose, really nutty and toasty in character, feeling quite dense and chewy even from the nose. Fruity and sweet mouth entrance, quickly followed by lingering, strong bready cereals. I should have drunk it earlier as the hop aromas are quite faded, heading more towards leafy tea flavours and vague citrus as it stands, finishing with vegetal, moist, earthy notes that dont feel very fresh. In mouth, they still provide generous bitterness for a lager, but in a tired way. This feels bigger than it is...really full maltiness and less crisp than whats claimed on the label! Interesting to see an English brewery try an.. Americanized take on a classic lager style.

A - Darker amber than expected with a decent head that lasted.
S - Bready Yeast, Fruit, spicy, grass, bit of hop
T - Hoppier than the smell, a bit nutty, and crisp on the tongue
M - Very smooth and silky, really quite gorgious.
O - One that is better than the sum of its parts. Great example of the style!

Bottle: Poured a deep copper/brown color lager with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of caramelized malt with some notes of dry and piney hops is quite refreshing. Taste is a good balance between some pine and dry floral hops with some caramelized sugar and just the rate amount of sweetness. Body is full for style with good carbonation. Well brewed with nice hoppy level and solid malt backbone.

Pint at York Tap into a long fluted glass.  Amber red with a good creamy head.  Coffee taste with roasted malt, very nice.  Hint of licorice as well, and a little fizzy.  Sweet, light and almost sherry aroma, with a hint of coffee.
Bottle 500 ml.  Pours dark copper with little off white head. Aroma: caramel and malt. Taste is the same, with sometihing like lactic acid (?). A good beer I guess, but it is not really my style...

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2012 Bottle 500 ml. Thanks to SlovakSniper! Dark copper with small off-white head. Nose of caramel with earthy notes. Taste is caramel and slight hops with earthy notes. Mouthfeel is oily. Not my favorite style but not a bad beer.

2/VI/2012 - 50cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - bottled: 20/VI/12 (2012-571) 
Clear amber coloured beer, small light beige head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, peaches, some exotic fruits, sweet, some American hops, hint of caramel. MF: good carbon, medium body. Taste: fruity start, exotic fruits, some peaches, little sweet, malty, caramel, bit of honey, citrus fruits, bitter hops. Aftertaste: exotic fruits, bit of grapefruit, nice bitter ending.

500ml bottle.
Pours a medium amber, beige head.
Malty aroma, light roast, caramel, fudge, citrusy hop notes.
Off-dry, medium body and bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty taste, caramel, fudge, hints of diacetyl, faintly hoppy.
(2012-02-13)

Bottled	04/05/12.  A ruby to chestnut coloured beer with a whitish head.  Sweet and malty with fruity hops.  Pretty chewy texture.  Late fruity hops are nice but otherwise its not really my thing.  Definitely a nouveau Vienna.

50 cl bottle at Plain Kitchen, Göteborg, on April 28, 2012. BB 20.08.12Hazy copper color, medium sized off-white head. Acidic, berry, fruity, sweet, alcohol scent. Sweet, malty, alcohol taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium low bitterness.

Bottle at Plain Kitchen cons 2012-04-27 Göteborh
Ar: almonds, hoppy, bread
Ap: ruby, frothy bone white head
F: almond nuttiness, low carb and bitterness, wee salt

From Voldby, DK.
Bottled, 200412.
Amber with white head. Aroma of malt. Flavour with caramel and balanced spices.

500 ml bottle from Bieropholie, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 02AL12.
App.:  Clear deep copper with a nice off-white froth.
  
Aroma:  Fairly fruity, apple juice, some berries, a little brightness, caramel and toffee, light bread crust, a little brown/burnt sugar.
  
Palate:  Medium body, restrained effervescence, silky.
  
Flav.:  Bread crust, somewhat fruity, a little austere, brown sugar, light toffee, not as fruity as the nose; dry with low bitterness and a fairly pleasant slightly fruity, brown sugar malty finish.

Mean name, meek beer.
30th December 2011ChrisOs Christmas Tasting. Clear brown beer. Good cream coloured head. Light dry palate. Dry caramel malt. Nice sweet hops - piney with mild citrus. Semi dry finish. Decent.
Draft. An amber beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of caramel and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and caramel, leading to a dry finish.
Bottle. Copper coloured with white head. Great nose. Thick malty flavour with some nice fruity hops in the mix. Great take on the style. Such a rich version of a lager.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours a clear amber with an off-white head.Sweet caramellish nose with a discreet whiff of citrusy hops. Medium body, sweet roast and subtle caramel with a pleasant hop edge. A dry and lightly hoppy finish. Very smooth and elegant. 310312
Bottle @ FOneFan. Clear amber with medium off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, fruit and a little hop. Flavour is malt, caramel, fruit, hops, little citrus, little pine and medium bitter.
Bottle @ Fonefan tasting. Nice creamy head with excellent duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are caramel, malt, fruits and hops. Medium carbonated and semi full bodied.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Clear amber with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 300312

500ml bottle from IPB.
Appearance : Clear amber medium head. Light lacing.

Aroma : Piny and citrusy hops with overcooked caramel. Fairly fruity with nice malty backbone.

Taste : Piny and citrusy but not as much hops as the nose suggest. Malty with caramel notes. Finish light bitterness with lots of malt. Light piny notes.

Palate : Average carbonation level.  

Overall : Not really a Vienna because of all the piny and resinous aromatic hops. Quite good even of not to style. Nice bitterness with nice malt. Very drinkable. In my opinion this is not as quenching as a regular vienna because of the resinous hops.

Aroma:caramel,peaches,light cooked vegetable nose...
Appearance:Clear cooper,good head..
Flavor:sweet,caramel,peaches,light grapefruit.....
Bottle from Great Grog. Medium brown colour with reddish hue & good head. Caramel hop aroma. Caramel chocolate hop flavour. Creamy texture with bitter sweet aftertaste. Quite unusual.

Bottle. [thanks Feldthaus]
Pours chestnut red with a small, frothy, off-white film head. Aroma has peach, grapefruit, light caramel. Medium carbonation, dry mouthfeel. Flavour is malty, softly toasted. Sweet, but with elegant balancing dryness. Okay.
Caramel/Copper colour with a small white head. Weird smell, smoked. Tastes like a typical ale, flat and a bit bitter. Thin body, okay carbo.
malty, amber, clear, ice cream head... that just keeps coming and coming and coming

(50 cl.  BB 29/06/2012)  Une robe brune acajou.  Un beau petit col mousseux.  Des parfums de houblons métalliques qui traversent un malt qui nest jamais trop sucré.  Un goût qui suit les arômes.  Des céréales douces qui sont touchées par des houblons contenus mais tout de même présents.  Une bouche correcte.  Une expression convenable des bulles.  Une texture à la limite huileuse.  Une finale plus ou moins douce qui coule vers quelques notes amères.

My Bottom Line:
Lightly toasted malts cooperate with peppery noble hops in this lean and big-bubbled Vienna.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A healthy head of foam covers up the amber gown.
-The hop bitterness is also quite peppery, with a herbal touch.
-Watery passages are felt.
-Subtle tomatoes are tasted in the finish. Strange

Bottle.

What a bee. Beatiful copper colour, but its taste deserves bronze at least. Incredibly balanced, just perfect. Malty, full, hoppy (clear but subtle), long aftertaste. This was my first Thornbridge beer, it will certainly not be my last.

Style et résumé: Vienna un peu trop maltée. 
Comment: Bouteille de 500ml. Achetée par IPB. (BB. 29.06.2012) 
Description: Bière de couleur noisette avec une belle mousse beige. Le nez, qui à mon avis est désagréable, offre des noix et du caramel. Le nez est trop «malt Munich» à mon goût. La bouche est ferme et ronde. Les saveurs sont de caramel, de noix et de malt grillé. Est-ce que cette bière était trop vielle ? 
Note: 6/10

Bottle from Ninas Mini Mart, Edinburgh
Copper amber...clear...dense frothy off white head (super from a bottle).....good lacing
Aroma - light spicy grassy hops...hint of yeast.....bit of cereal malt
Taste - light grassy spicy hops...some sweet caramel...slight hint of toffee...a tiny touch of toasted malt and berry fruit....good tasting quite malty lager
Palate soft to medium carb...medium body..slight citrus tang and bitter spicyness on palate. Finish - Rapid citrus grass tang then a light bitter toast takes over in the slight linger...then cleans well
Overall - a very well made craft lager

[500ml bottle, Appellation Wine, Edinburgh] Brownish amber pour with a decent white head. Sweet, slightly spiced nose. Honey as well. On the flavour, a touch of bready malt, with some brown sugar and caramel. Lovely snappy dry finish. The first flavours made me think of an American style brown ale, but the cutting lager finish made it a perfect Vienna. Shuts the door in your face, a perfect clean aftertaste. Lovely [01032012]

Bottle at home. Dark red-orange colour, thin head. Steely lager aroma, with slight toffee sweetness. Grassy, pleasantly sweetish metallic flavour, with a bitter, burnt toffee finish. Nicely balanced, very tasty.

Bottle at home. Glorious dark copper colour, thick creamy head. Looks absolutely perfect. Grassy, grainy metallic lager nose. As it should be. Crisp malt sweetness, slightly juicy citrus, amazingly refreshing yet full-bodied with a dry finish. A brilliant example of less is more.

Draught at Moeder Lambic.
Clear orange-red coloured with a huge off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel and bread with notes of hops.
Sweet and fruity flavour of caramel, bread and hops with notes of liquorice.
Hoppy finish.
Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Clear golden/amber - small white head. Fruity, nutty, toasted, ok hoppy, light fruity coffee aroma, roasted, light bitterness, berrie notes, black berries.

Pours a clear amber color with a thick offwhite head. Nice aroma of toasted malt, caramel and fruity, resinous hops. Good flavor of citrusy, slightly resinous hops with toasted malt and caramel, theres restrained bitterness in the end. The body is medium with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Very interesting!

Bottle. Bronze with a small head.Slightly malty but apart from that nothing is really that memorable.Strange title for a beer especially one l with nothing too memorable too offer. Below  average for this for this usually creative brewery, Still everyone has an off day!

50 cl bottle @ home, BBE 21.06.2012
Aroma has fruity american hops, some malt and hints of metal. Feels a bit tart and contaminated. Flavour is hoppy with some roasted malt and hints of metal. Tart finish. Quite messy stuff, not in balance.

50 cl bottle. BBE 21.06.2012.
Pours clear copper color with a large head. Aroma of hops, fresh fruits, goose berry bush, malts, grass and some wood. Flavor of citrus, nettle, hops, gosse berries, mild malts, pine needles and some nutty notes. Quite unbalanced.

500 ml bottle. BBE 21.06.2012.
Pours a amber brown colour with a large, thick, white head. Aroma of American hops, orange juice and metals. Flavour of stuffy malts, nuts, old hops, gooseberries and metals again. Light vegetable notes as well. Medium bodied, dry mouthfeel and a malty, light sweet finish. Clearly not a fresh bottle and has some disturbing flavours.

500ml bottle

Pours dark orange with a large foamy white head. Aroma of fruity hops, malts and spices. Taste is bready and malty with some fruity notes. Finishes with a typical lager taste and some bitterness. Okay, a bit unbalanced.

From tap at Moeder Lambic. Pours clear and golden deep amber and orange with a small white and lacing head. Aroma is fruity, light malty and caramelish. Sweet, fruity and light toasted malty flavoured. Sweet and toasted malty finish. Light bitter finish.

Bottle.  Brownish bronze beer with a strongish head.  The aroma is caramel hopped, and the flavour is smoothly roasted with a mildly hopped and slightly malty finish.  Overall an average palatable beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled @ home. BBF March 12. Clear amber color, medium lasting off-white head. Aroma of caramel malt, bit toffee, some grainy german/austrian touch. Slight fruity hops, but in the bottle Im having (which might be a bit older) the malts dominate. Quite bitter in taste, but also has a sweet tooth with again caramel and toffee. Finishes bit sticky. Very tasty brew.

50cl bottle. Pours dark amber with a nicely proportioned head. The nose has pine and some floral notes. The taste has toffee, ginger and pine again. The palate is very crisp as the bottle says, but the body is fuller and creamier than I expected. Overall, nice but a strange combination of lager yeasts with the body of a bitter. I like it but Im confused.

Bottle. Reddish copper color with a large white head. The nose is biscuity, plenty of honey, tobacco. The taste is medium malty, sweet and quite crisp with a lightly dry finish. Light/medium body, medium carbonation. Overall, pleasant. Not bad.

Bottle from Bierkompas.de. Dark amber color with huge white head. Aroma of caramel, honey, apples, floral hops. Taste, caramel, grapefruit, dark fruit, molasses, floral hops in background. Fruity, bitter finish. Good.

Bottle.  Copper with a large off white foam.  Aromas are dusty yeast with toffee and vinous notes.  Berries and cream with strawberry in particular.   Earthy with bubblegum and mellow spices.  Flavours are yeast, bubblegum and mixed berries with bittersweet lemon.  Leafy green notes with a floral, dry and clean finish.  Pretty good.
Great beer as usual - solid malty backbone with a dusting of hops. Body is abut thin but apart from that its awesome!

Bottled 500ml (BB 08/2012)
Clear ruby-amber color, good cloudy off-white head. Fruity-flowery Amarillo aroma. Light bodied. Caramel, fruityness, flowery hoppyness. Maybe light buttery notes too. Lingering fruity sweetness in the aftertaste. Yes, not very traditional and not very lagerish.

Bottled (from bierkompass.de). Deep amber colour, mediumsized foamy slightly off-white head. Leaves nice lace. Aroma is rather bitter fruity hops with some slight spicy notes and mild maltyness as well. Flavour is quite bitter fruity and floral notes along with some slight herbal and mild spicy notes. Mild sweet maltyness as well. Finishes in a rather bitter fruity way.

From a bottle. Pours dark amber with decent head, looks great. Aroma has bready yeast, grassy and some fruity hops. Taste has some caramel, bread, some hops, not entirely pleasant but ok. Quite sweet with not much dryness. An alright lager, different.
Amber clear body with an off-white head. Aroma of caramalts, hops, wine ... Bit unbalanced, has interesting components that sadly enough dont blend. Weak lghtly bitter, lightly sweet flavour.

Amber brown colour, off-white head. Light aroma, caramel, light biscuit, malts. Malty sweet flavour, light bitter. Light sweet finish, caramel, light hops. Rather OK, though not the most outgoing character in the Thornbridge family.
(From 33cL bottle @ RBBWG 2012, Antwerpen. Thanks for sharing, Bart!)

Bottled: Malty nose with caramel, toffee and a hint of molasse. Brown, light reddish color, beige head. Flavor is malty, medium sweet but also fresh and fruity. Caramelic, berries and well hopped. Atypical hop bitterness for that style but even better.

bottle @ RBBWG 2012. Clear brown coloured vienna style beer with some light carbonation and a small slightly off white head. Malty slightly herby hinted aroma. Medium to full palate. Finish is rather sweet and somewhat malty hinteD. Misses some character. Not really my cup of tea.
Pours a copper colour with a white head.  Aromas of bread, malt and fruit.  Similar flavours along with a hint of hop.  Nice.

50 cl. bottle sampled @ RBWG 2012  thx to Bart  amber brown with a slight red hue and white head, smells like bready caramel malts mixed with citrus hops, taste is bitter citrus hops mixed with bready malts, slight caramel & dark fruits, both parts of this beer hops & malts are clearly present, medium body and carbonation

50 cl bottle @ RBBWG 2012, Antwerpen, courtesy of Bart.
Ambrée à la limite de lorangé, venant du malt, col crémeux beige.
Ressent de suite un malt vienna qui reste en ligne avec un type Munich et un houblon discret, le tout donne ce léger côté caramel doux voire sucrée/toasted. Houblon prend ici le siège arrière se faisant discret. Sympa et léger à boire.

Good, receding pale cream-coloured head over amber-brown beer, slightly veiled. Little aroma, bit of biscuit - chocolatebiscuits maybe - dark green leaves; Hoppy, with undertones of dark chocolate, getting sweet in the finish. Pretty well-balanced. Not very well-bodied, bit slick. Seems somewhat undercarbonated (or is that to please CAMRA?). Good balance, but not really great beer.

Bottle. Amber, average to large and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, some caramel and tropical fruitiness, some citrus - herbal hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and sweetish flavor, some caramel with fruitiness, some citrus - herbal hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, light caramel with light fruitiness, some herbal hoppynesshoppyness. Nice fruitiness and hoppyness - bit too sweet and too much caramel. Nice one, though.
Pours copper with a beige head. Aroma is roasted breaddy malt, fruity notes and light caramel. Flavour follows the nose.

Bottle 500ml. @ chriso [ chrisos festive get-together tasting ].Clear medium to dark amber colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, light beige to beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, moderate to light heavy hoppy, citrus, grass, orange - citrus. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20111230]
ambrata buona schiuma buona persitenza naso maltato tostato caramello ed agrumato in bocca maltata con finale delicatamente luppolato agrumato

500ml Bottle - Copper/red with a foamy head. Toffee, grapefruit and nuts in the aroma. Nutty, hoppy and fruity taste with notes of fudge, dried fruit and citrus. Nice, tasty and an interesting twist on a Vienna.

Bottle from Ninas. Pours an amber - brown colour with a decent beige head. Nice malty aroma of Ovaltine with citrus notes of lemon and orange rind, some grass and yeast also. Similar citrisy, malty flavours. Moderate carbonation, light CO2 prickle and a dry finish. This works for me.

500ml bottle. Clear, astonishingly dark copper with quickly diminishing though lacing off-white head. Amarillo hop dominates aroma completely. Taste starts in a surprising way with Märzen-like caramel malt on the "geographic" antipodal side. Sweetness is then wiped out by the Amarillo anew. Hops and malts do not complement perfectly, but its been worth a try. Really a special one.

500ml bottle, best before 27.08.12, drunk in December 2011. Clear, clean amber appearance. Clean on the palate too. Biscuity malts on the nose and palate. Seemed to have a much stronger aromatic hop presence, no doubt from the Amarillo, than when I tried it before on draught (for which I cant find the notes right now). Not usually a style I enjoy too much, probably because of the usually relatively low hop character but this hit the spot nicely, probably because of the atypically high hop presence.
Bottle at Craigs house. roasty, amber, clear, minimal head, light sweetness.
Bottle at home ... deep copper ... thin off white head ... over fizzy ... soft toffeee malts ... light grassyness ... sweet fruits ... little vanilla ... ok but not me ... little herbal ...
Ruby, amber color. Big white head. Plenty of lacing. A dry hoppy, malty aroma. Malty taste. Nice.

Bottle. Pours a reddish-copper with a white head. Aroma is appealing an oily hop maltiness. Carbonation is low to medium and the lager settles nicely into the glass just waiting to be drunk. Palate is thin and soft but taste is sweet malty caramel which drys nicely to an almost malted milk biscuit finish. Nice gentle, well-crafted beer from Thornbridge.
Pours a clear and copper beer with an offwhite head. The aroma is malt, fruit, sweetness and bread. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is dry with sweetness. Overall an average beer.
50cl, new exclusive English brew Anno 2011, from Brouwerij de Molen Bodegraven, complex brew, sweet/malty and slightly fruity, easy to drink, balanced, clear, good head, nice brew
Bottle @ Early Winter Tasting,  Odense, 2011. Pours clear amber with small white head. Fruit and caramel. A bit of berries. Medium bodied. Dry end.
Copper with a lasting off-white head. Aroma of malt, toffee and caramel, with a bit of fruit. Sweetish malty flavour with a fruity note, herbal hops and a nice bitter finish

Bottle 500 ml bought @ bir&fud bottega (Rome, Italy). Malty aroma, of biscuit in particular. A little yeasty note, caramel too. White one-finger foam, like a sheet on a red/orange/ruby totally clear and beautiful to see. Medium to high carbonation in a watery body. Contribution of Tettnanger is recognizable of course, not precisely the same about the Amarillo. High sugar taste. Just something bitter and harsh in the finish. A standard vienna, as much as many others.

Bottle thanks to Joes at Zieke Zuiden Tasting II. Clear dark copper / light amber color, small off-white head. Smell sweet and malty. Taste malts, lightly bitter. Low to medium carbonation, medium body.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2011 Bottle @ ZZT11 #2: Thanks to Joes:
Small white head, disappears quick, on top of a clear dark orange amber colored beer.
Smell malts, barleys, sweets, dark sugars, 
Taste is less than smell: light hops, malts, barleys some dark fruuts and light sweets.
Light hoppy light fruity malty aftertaste.
Low carbo, soft creamy mouthfeel, medium body and a creamy texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Dark amber brown and clear body. Nice aroma, sweet malts, mild flowery hops. Pleasantly bitter and refreshing, subtle hops. Great drinkability
500ml bottle.  Pours dark copper with a medium head.  Aroma is caramel, grass and apple.  Taste is caramel to start, with caramel, apple and a little smoke.

Keg at Craft Beer Co., London. Pours clear brown with a foamy, off-white head. Toasty malts and caramel on the nose, some toffee, too. Medium sweet flavor, more toast, caramel, sugar. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Clean sweet finish, toasty malts, caramel. Easygoing beer.
Keg at Craft Beer Co.  Deep brown red colour.  Lasting beige.  Bit of choc which is nice.  Tasty enough vienna.  Good malts good flavours.  Really drinkable.

Bottle from Vineyard, Belfast.

Pours a ruby red with thin beige head. Spicy fruit aroma with a good malt body and gentle spicy hop character. Medium bodied, very smooth.

Bottle that my dad brought along and we consumed at a family party, near Pontadarwe, Wales 20.08.11   Pours darker than I was expecting sort of dark brown with some reddy glints. , nice malty aroma and flavours, little bit of balsamic, touch of yeast, not bad at all.  A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov14 3.6

50cl bottle from the brewery. Heady, sweet malt aroma, with warm bread, kicks off this ruby brew. Initial impression of the flavour was ripe, almost sour fruit, but this quickly became a very pleasant light caramel, with a lovely yeasty aftertaste and a rounded alchol finish that is excellent. The hops kick in late, to add a further dimension to this impressive beer, with fresh grassiness coming through.

50 cl bottle, Sheffield, UK via The Dram Shop. Deep chestnut colour, clear and bright. Heavy raisin aroma with some lingering hop spice. Sweet, then a bright bitterness with some celery and soy. Sweet finish, long and fresh.
